intro: Ludwigia alternifolia var. pubescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically borne in clusters near the base of the stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for water gardens and pond landscapes.
